meanings.definition: The action of hitting someone or something repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The battering of the drums echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a series of powerful batterings to his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The battering ram made a comical squeaking sound as it hit the door.
meanings.sent4: The battering raindrops relentlessly pelted the roof all night.
meanings.sent5: The battering waves crashed against the shore, eroding the cliffs over time.

meanings.sent1: The team suffered a humiliating battering in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The army faced a devastating battering in the battle.
meanings.sent3: Despite the battering defeat, they vowed to come back stronger next time.
meanings.sent4: The stock market took a battering after the unexpected economic downturn.
meanings.sent5: The battering they received in the debate left them speechless.

meanings.definition: The process of coating food in a mixture of flour and liquid before cooking.
meanings.sent1: She dipped the chicken into the battering before frying it.
meanings.sent2: The chef demonstrated the proper technique for battering fish.
meanings.sent3: The battering spilled over the edges of the bowl as she mixed it.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the freshly fried battering filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The golden battering gave the fried food a crispy texture.
